trans-unit.source: Describes the height or width of a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Figure"></xref>.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*length*
The width or height of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Figure> in pixels, described as a <xref:System.Double> value.
Alternatively, this value can be qualified with a unit declaration string (`px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`) see *qualifiedDouble* below.
*qualifiedDouble*
A *double* value as described above followed by one of the following unit declaration strings: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
`cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px
`pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> class with the specified number of pixels in length.
The number of device-independent pixels (96 pixels-per-inch) that make up the length.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength.Value"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength.FigureUnitType"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength.FigureUnitType"></xref> class.

Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is a <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> and whether it is identical to this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare to this instance.
`true` if oCompare is a and is identical to this ; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> structures for equality.
The <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> to compare to this instance.
`true` if figureLength is identical to this ; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the unit type of the <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength.Value"></xref>.
The value that goes along with this unit type can be found using the <xref:System.Windows.FigureLength.Value%2A> property.
This property is read-only.
To set the value of this property, use the <xref:System.Windows.FigureLength.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The unit type of this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength.Value"></xref>.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType.Auto"></xref>.
Returns the hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref>.
The hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> structure.
Gets a value that determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> holds an absolute value (in pixels).
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> holds an absolute value (in pixels); otherwise, **false**.
The default value is **false**.
Gets a value that determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> is automatic (not specified).
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> is automatic (not specified); otherwise, **false**.
The default value is **true**.

Gets a value that determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> has a <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType"></xref> property value of <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType.Column"></xref>.

**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> has a <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType"></xref> property value of <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType.Column"></xref>; otherwise, **false**.
The default value is **false**.

Gets a value that determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> has a <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType"></xref> property value of <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType.Content"></xref>.

Returns **true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> has a <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType"></xref> property value of <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType.Content"></xref>; otherwise, **false**.
The default value is **false**.

Gets a value that determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> has a <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType"></xref> property value of <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType.Page"></xref>.

**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> has a <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType"></xref> property value of <xref href="System.Windows.FigureUnitType.Page"></xref>; otherwise, **false**.
The default value is **false**.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> structures for equality.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Windows.FigureLength.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if fl1 and fl2 are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> structures for inequality.
The equivalent method for this operator is the negation of <xref:System.Windows.FigureLength.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref> structure to compare.
`true` if fl1 and fl2 are not equal; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref>.
Gets the value of this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref>.
The unit type of this value can be found using the <xref:System.Windows.FigureLength.FigureUnitType%2A> property.
This property is read-only.
To set the value of this property, use the <xref:System.Windows.FigureLength.%23ctor%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.FigureLength.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The value of this <xref href="System.Windows.FigureLength"></xref>.
The default value is 1.
